verb.description: Reject (someone or something) in an abrupt or ungracious manner.
examples: I asked her to be my wife, and was rebuffed in no uncertain terms

noun.description: An abrupt or ungracious refusal or rejection of an offer, request, or friendly gesture.
examples: any attempt to win her friendship was met with rebuffs

origin: Late 16th century: from obsolete French rebuffer (verb), rebuffe (noun), from Italian ri- (expressing opposition) + buffo a gust, puff, of imitative origin.
